headline: 3 Reasons Why This Ultra-Safe High-Yield Dividend Stock Is Worth Buying Now
summary: Shares of Clorox (NYSE: CLX) are  down 7.4% since it reported earnings on Feb. 3.  Clorox has come a long way in the last few years, but many of its investments have yet to translate to bottom-line results.  Here are three reasons patient investors should consider buying and holding the high-yield dividend stock over the long term.

headline: This High-Yield Dividend Stock Is Down 10% in 2025. Here's Why It's a Buy Now.
summary: Clorox (NYSE: CLX) is down 10.1% year to date at the time of this writing, with most of that drop occurring last week when the company reported second-quarter fiscal 2025 results.  With a 3.3% dividend yield and 40 consecutive years of dividend raises, Clorox stands out as a solid passive income opportunity, but only if the underlying business fundamentals improve.  Here's why the sell-off in Clorox stock is a buying opportunity for long-term investors.
